---
title: Sign the Allowance Transaction
slug: /guides/staking-api/polygon/delegate/sign-allowance-transaction
---

Sign the allowance transaction using the `transaction_payload` you received in response to submitting the allowance transaction data.

Locate the `transaction_payload` in the response from the previous step. It will look something like this:

```json
"transaction_payload": "0x02f86d05808459682f00850eaa6fba0e82b58394499d11e0b6eac7c0593d8fb292dcbbf815fb29ae80b844095ea7b300000000000000000000000000200ea4ee292e253e6ca07dba5edc07c8aa37a3ffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffc0"
```

:::caution important

Always confirm the details of the transaction before signing the payload.

Figment has a tool for signing and decoding Staking API payloads, see the guide [Signing Transactions with Figment's NPM Package](/guides/staking-api/figment-signing-transactions) to continue.

:::

Transactions can also be signed using [web3.js](https://web3js.readthedocs.io/en/v1.2.11/web3-eth-accounts.html#signtransaction) or [Fireblocks](/guides/staking-api/fireblocks-signing-transactions).

Sign the transaction and move on to the next step. A signed transaction payload for Polygon will look something like this:

```text

```
